posts.post_content:
this is my favorite card in this set so far, with [geosurge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=geosurge) tailing shortly behind it. green removal? for three? that destroys anything? guess wizards was sick of jace raping standard to even give green a clear answer to him lol. this card says one thing to me: F\*\*\* who? F\*\*\* 'em all.  
  
pulled this at pre release. first guy i played droped a turn seven[Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger )  and i turned it into a beast instantly. he was \*\*\*ed.

Posted By: DacenOctavio (5/3/2011 12:46:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Just awesome.
  
   
Green had so few answers to creatures (barring artifacts that all colors had access to), and now it gets one that's cheap *and* an instant. But that's not all: it hits 'walkers directly, which was something that green could not do well outside the combat step. It's looking like a fantastic card for any permutation of casual / multiplayer / EDH formats.
posts.html:
Just awesome.

posts.post_content: Insane control in a color that just recently only got shroud added to its arsenal ([Vines of vastwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vines of vastwood)). The idea isn't specifically to play it in monogreen deck. However, if you're playing green, chances are you won't be struggling in combat. Play it on offense, play it on defense (for example, when you're mana flooded), it screams for 4 in a deck.
posts.html:
